verses.text: 拿細耳人的條例耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: A person who has taken a Nazirite vow.
Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 「你要告訴以色列人，對他們說：『無論男女，如果許了特別的願，就是拿細耳人的願，就要離俗歸耶和華。

words.note: To separate oneself from the ordinary, for a religious purpose.

verses.text: 他要戒除淡酒和濃酒；淡酒作的醋和濃酒作的醋，他都不可喝；不可喝任何葡萄汁，也不可吃鮮葡萄或乾葡萄。
在他離俗的日子，葡萄樹上出產的，無論是葡萄核或是葡萄，都不可吃。
「『在他許願離俗的日子，不可用剃刀剃頭；他要聖潔，直到他離俗歸耶和華的日子滿了，他要由他的頭髮長長。

words.note: Lit. 'sacred and pure'.
Reduplication indicating duration or extent of 'growing long'.

verses.text: 「『在他離俗歸耶和華的日子，不可走近死人。

words.note: Refers to the Nazirite vow, separating oneself from the common.

verses.text: 他的父母、兄弟或是姊妹，死了的時候，他不可因他們玷污自己，因為離俗歸他 神的記號，在他的頭上；

words.note: Often refers to ceremonial defilement.
Refers to the Nazirite vow, separation from the common.
The empty space before 神 is a common reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 在他離俗的日子，他都是歸耶和華為聖的。

words.note: Refers to the Nazirite vow period.

verses.text: 「『如果在他身旁，突然有人死了，以致他離俗的頭被玷污了，他就要在得潔淨的日子剃頭，就是在第七日剃頭。

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Refers to the Nazirite vow.
Often refers to ceremonial defilement.
Refers to ceremonial purification.
Specific ritual shaving of the head.
Specific ritual shaving of the head.

verses.text: 第八天，他要把兩隻斑鳩，或是兩隻雛鴿，帶到會幕門口交給祭司。

words.note: Introduces object before the verb.
Refers to the ancient Israelite tent of meeting.

verses.text: 祭司要獻一隻作贖罪祭，一隻作燔祭，為他贖那因死人而玷污的罪；他要在當天使他的頭成為聖潔，
使他重新離俗歸耶和華的日子，又要帶一隻一歲的公羊羔來作贖愆祭；以前的日子無效，因為他的離俗被玷污了。
「『拿細耳人的律例是這樣：離俗的人的日子滿了那天，人要把他帶到會幕的門口；
他要把供物獻給耶和華，就是獻一隻完全沒有殘疾、一歲的公羊羔作燔祭，一隻完全沒有殘疾、一歲的母羊羔作贖罪祭，一隻完全沒有殘疾的公綿羊作平安祭，
一籃無酵調油的細麵餅和抹油的無酵薄餅，以及同獻的素祭和奠祭。

words.note: Lit. 'plain sacrifice', referring to offerings without blood.

verses.text: 祭司要在耶和華面前獻上這些供物，又要獻上他的贖罪祭和燔祭；

words.note: Refers to those who perform sacrifices and religious duties.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
An offering made to atone for sin.
An offering completely consumed by fire.

verses.text: 他又要把那隻公綿羊和那一籃無酵餅，獻給耶和華作平安祭；祭司也要把同獻的素祭和奠祭獻上。

words.note: Marks the direct object, indicating it is acted upon.
A male sheep, often used for sacrifices.
Bread made without yeast, symbolic of purity.
An offering symbolizing reconciliation and fellowship with God.
Connects a modifying phrase to the noun it describes.
An offering typically of flour or grain, sometimes with oil or incense.
An offering of poured-out liquid, usually wine.

verses.text: 拿細耳人要在會幕門口剃他離俗的頭，把他離俗的頭髮拿去，放在平安祭下的火上。

words.note: A person consecrated by a special vow to God.
The portable sanctuary used by Israelites before the Temple.
Refers to being separated from ordinary use for a holy purpose.
Here used as a postposition to indicate location 'under'.
Here used as a postposition to indicate location 'on'.

verses.text: 拿細耳人剃去了自己離俗的頭髮以後，祭司就要取那煮過的公綿羊的一條前腿，又要從籃子裡取一個無酵餅和一個無酵薄餅，都放在拿細耳人的手上。

words.note: A thin, unleavened cake.

verses.text: 祭司要把這些作為搖祭，在耶和華面前搖一搖；這些作搖祭獻上的胸和作舉祭的腿，同為聖物歸給祭司；然後拿細耳人才可以喝酒。

words.note: An offering presented by a ritual waving motion.
Used in V-一-V construction to denote a brief action.
An offering presented by a ritual lifting motion.
Items consecrated for use in worship or as offerings.
Implies a condition must be met first.

verses.text: 「『許願的拿細耳人的律例是這樣：他獻給耶和華的供物是照著他離俗的願，不是根據他手上所得的；他怎樣許願，就當怎樣照著離俗的律例而行。』」

words.note: Verb-object compound
A person consecrated to God by a vow
Formal rules or laws
Verb-complement structure
The personal name of God in the Old Testament
Something offered to a deity
To depart from ordinary customs, esp. for religious consecration
Used here as a noun, 'a vow'
Here acts as a locative particle forming '手上' (in hand)
Literally 'that which is obtained'
Verb-object compound
Indicates consequence or immediacy
To depart from ordinary customs, esp. for religious consecration
Formal rules or laws
Literary: 'and (then) act'

verses.text: 祭司祝福的話耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: One who performs religious rites
Can be noun 'blessing' or verb 'to bless'
The personal name of God in the Old Testament

verses.text: 「你要告訴亞倫和他的兒子說：『你們要這樣為以色列人祝福，對他們說：

words.note: The people of Israel
Can be noun 'blessing' or verb 'to bless'

verses.text: 願耶和華賜福你，保護你；

words.note: Used to express a wish or desire
The personal name of God in the Old Testament
More formal than just '祝福'

verses.text: 願耶和華使他的臉光照你，賜恩給你；

words.note: Used to express a wish or desire
The personal name of God in the Old Testament
Causative verb
Refers to God's favorable presence
More formal way to say 'show grace'
Here used as a preposition indicating recipient

verses.text: 願耶和華敞臉垂顧你，賜你平安。』

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Lit. 'open face'; idiomatically means to show favor or goodwill.
Suggests a higher being looking down with care.
Often used for bestowal by a superior.
A common greeting and farewell in Chinese culture.

verses.text: 他們要這樣奉我的名為以色列人祝福（「奉我的名為以色列人祝福」直譯是「把我的名放在以色列人身上」），我就會親自賜福給以色列人（「以色列人」直譯是「他們」）。

words.definition: in the name of, by command of
words.note: Formal or religious usage.
Can refer to personal name or authority/reputation.
Can be used for human or divine blessings.
Emphasizes the divine source of the blessing.
